_comment: Created by EFisher on 12/10/2015 14:31:47 using v2.7
title: How has the number of managerial staff in the NHS changed over time?
analysis_commentary: Contrary to popular opinion there has been a substantial decrease (17-18%) in the number of managers and senior managers employed within the NHS. In September 2009 there were 12,981 senior managers and 29,741 managers, which have dropped to 10, 687 and 24,794 respectively in May 2015.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, NHS Hospital & Community Health Service Workforce Statistics
